required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Thrombolysis With Intra-arterial Urokinase for Acute Superior Mesenteric Artery Occlusion: Outcome Analysis

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with acute superior mesenteric artery (SMA) occlusion were included in this study. The clinical presentation and effect of the recanalization of the SMA was analyzed on follow-up angiography.

detailed_description.textblock:
Thirteen patients with acute SMA occlusion who underwent intra-arterial urokinase thrombolysis between 2008 and 2020 were retrospectively evaluated.
Clinically, the abdominal pain and the effect of the SMA on angiography will be compared in response and non-response groups.

primary_outcome.measure: Thrombolysis with intra-arterial urokinase for acute superior mesenteric artery occlusion: Outcome analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily series follow-up angiography in the next 72 hours after thrombolysis with intra-arterial urokinase.
primary_outcome.description: Degree of patency and appearance of the SMA will be analyzed in the follow-up angiography.

arm_group.arm_group_label: According to the degree of occlusion, 13 patients were divided into complete and incomplete groups.
arm_group.description: Seven patients were complete occlusion and 6 patients were incomplete occlusion and all underwent thrombolysis with intra-arterial urokinase and the outcome was analysed..

intervention.description: Under local anaesthesia, the right femoral artery was punctured in accordance with the Seldinger technique, and a 6-Fr sheath, 10 cm in length, was implanted. Selective catheterization of the SMA was performed with 4-Fr catheter. The SMA angiography was performed to identify the filling defect. Thrombolysis was performed using a 5-Fr multiple-sideport infusion catheter (100cm with sideport of 7cm, 14 ports or 100cm with sideport of 15cm, 30 ports, Cook, Bloomington, IN, U.S.A). The tip of the microcatheter was embedded in the thromboembolism, which was fragmented at the time of thrombolysis. Thrombolysis was performed locally in the SMA with a bolus of urokinase
intervention.arm_group_label: According to the degree of occlusion, 13 patients were divided into complete and incomplete groups.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of SMA occlusion
Exclusion Criteria:
- shock in the triage screening
- peritonitis
- 3. intramural gas, mesenteric or portal venous gas on contrast-enhanced abdominal CT

Acute mesenteric ischemia: guidelines of the World Society of Emergency Surgery. World J Emerg Surg. 2017 Aug 7;12:38. doi: 10.1186/s13017-017-0150-5. eCollection 2017. Review.
